docs.lead_paragraph: The long lives that some former cannibals enjoy before succumbing to a brain-wasting disease suggest that many more humans will eventually die of mad cow disease, scientists said Thursday.

headline.main: Study Suggests More Deaths From Mad Cow Disease

docs.lead_paragraph: Condoms protect against human papillomavirus, a cause of warts and cervical and other cancers, a study found.

headline.main: Condoms Found to Block a Virus Harmful to Women
headline.print_headline: Condoms Found to Block A Virus Harmful to Women

docs.snippet: Condoms protect against human papillomavirus, a cause of warts and cervical and other cancers, a study found.

docs.lead_paragraph: The consistent use of condoms protects against human papillomavirus, a cause of warts and cervical and other female cancers, researchers are reporting today. In the study, which independent experts said was the most conclusive to examine the role of condoms in preventing infection with the virus, women whose male partners used condoms every time they had sexual intercourse had less than half the rate of infection as did women whose partners used condoms less than 5 percent of the time.

headline.main: Condoms Found to Block A Virus Harmful to Women
